problem_text:
Let πe(G) denote the set of orders of elements of a group G. For Γ ⊆ N let h(Γ) denote the number of non-isomorphic finite groups G with πe(G) = Γ. Is there a number k such that, for every Γ, either h(Γ) ⩽ k, or h(Γ) = ∞?
W. J. Shi
answer: No, there is no such number: h(πe(L3(73r))) = r+1 for any r ⩾ 0 (A. V. Zavarnitsine, J. Group Theory, 7, no. 1 (2004), 81–97).
